alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roswell, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell and Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 104 and 116. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
